quest.name: Yugiri's Game
journal: Hozan has another favor to ask of you.

* This quest has been adjusted. Please abandon the quest and restart it by speaking to Alphinaud at the Quicksand.

※The Main Scenario Guide shows the next available quest. You can toggle it on and off in Character Configuration, under UI Settings.

Hozan is proud of his son, and with good reason: Yozan has already instructed the other children to make their preparations. The only ones who have yet to be located are a trio who were engaged in a game of hide-and-seek. It would seem that the children are very serious when it comes to the game, and will not move from their hiding spots unless found, leaving you with no choice but to find them yourself.
Despite their dedication to the game, the three remaining children were not particularly good at it. Inform Hozan that your work is finished.

You learn that Yugiri is responsible for the children's regular practice of hide-and-seek, as she deemed it necessary to ensure their survival in the event of an imperial attack. Many would consider it a valuable skill, to be sure─albeit one Hozan hopes the children never need to use.

dialogue.name: HOUZAN
dialogue.text: While you were seeing to that crate, the other members of my group finished preparing their belongings for shipment. Once all of the carriages arrive, we can begin loading.

dialogue.name: HOUZAN
dialogue.text: Oh, but you needn't concern yourself with that! We can manage with the coachmen's help.

dialogue.name: HOUZAN
dialogue.text: Rather, I would like you to help round up the children that have been given into my care. My son Yozan can tell you more.

dialogue.name: HOUZAN
dialogue.text: These have been trying times, but Yozan has handled himself well. I only wish there were more I could do for him.

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: Oh, hello there! I'm Yozan, son of Hozan. Will you be coming with us to Ul'dah? I hear we're traveling by horsebird-drawn carriage!

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: But...don't you think they're queer? Giant birds that people ride like horses? I still want to try riding one, but─

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: What's that? You're looking for the others? Don't worry. I already told them to get ready for the carriages.

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: I'll need your help, though. We were just finishing a game of hide-and-seek. Three players are still in hiding, and since Lady Yugiri told us to take it really seriously, they won't move until they're found. But Vesper Bay isn't that big, so I bet you can find them in no time!

dialogue.name: KOHARU
dialogue.text: Hey! You're not Yozan! Who're you?

dialogue.name: KOHARU
dialogue.text: (-Koharu-)I'm Koharu. Forename Surname, eh? I didn't know anyone else was─ Waaait a minute! You're one of those, um, Stallions, aren't you!?

dialogue.name: KOHARU
dialogue.text: (-Koharu-)No─ Scions, Scions! Then you must know Lady Yugiri, right? Isn't she great!? She's really good at hide-and-seek, too! Oh, right─ It's almost time to go. Nice meeting you, Forename Surname!

dialogue.name: CHILD01350A
dialogue.text: How'd you find me!? Bah! Guess I need to practice more.

dialogue.name: CHILD01350A
dialogue.text: Or maybe you're just good at this? I mean, the Garleans didn't find me...

dialogue.name: CHILD01350B
dialogue.text: Um... Are you playing? Ahhh! No fair! Yozan didn't say anything about adults!

dialogue.name: CHILD01350B
dialogue.text: Huh? We get to ride a horsebird carriage? I don't know... It sounds scary. But if Yozan says it's safe, I'll go.

dialogue.name: HOUZAN
dialogue.text: Wonderful! All the children are accounted─ Hide-and-seek? Ah, I see that you are curious. It is quite simple, really.

dialogue.name: HOUZAN
dialogue.text: Lady Yugiri thought it best that the children know what to do in case the Garleans found us.

dialogue.name: HOUZAN
dialogue.text: I should hope that those days are behind us, but I nevertheless take comfort in knowing that we are prepared.
